page.title: 03PENBOYR V.(A)P. SCHOOL
page.content: Penboyr Primary School is a Voluntary Aided School of the Church in Wales.It was opened on July 6th 1866 when thirty pupils were registered during the first week. It was built on a plot of land adjoining St. Barnabas Church on the banks of the river Esgair. At first it was a small school but owing to the expansion of the woollen industry in the locality in the latter part of the last century it had to be extended and additions were built in 1873 and 1895. At present there are 102 pupils on roll. It is staffed by four permanent teachers, including the headteacher, and two peripatetic teachers in music and remedial education. The main language of the school is Welsh but as it serves a Welsh and English community most of the teaching is bilingual. The aim is to make all pupils bilingual.{A.Davies
